info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 5:15AM MDT until May 29 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong southwest winds combined with above normal warmth, and an extremely dry and unstable airmass will lead to widespread critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions across all of northern and central New Mexico today. Overnight humidity recoveries will be poor in many areas while winds stay locally strong, allowing localized elevated to critical fire weather conditions to persist tonight and again Sunday evening. Strong winds will return Memorial Day over eastern and southern New Mexico while temperatures will be cooler over the west. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau from 9 AM to 10 PM MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to between 40 and 50 mph today. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity will range between 8 and 15 percent today. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
